newsitem.title: INDIA: Profit-taking caps Delhi bourse's gains.
newsitem.headline: Profit-taking caps Delhi bourse's gains.

text.p: Delhi stocks inched higher in early afternoon trade on Thursday but profit-takers kept a lid on the gains by selling shares in select multinationals, brokers said.
At 12:45 p.m. (0715 GMT), the Delhi Stock Exchange's benchmark index was up 2.23 points at 809.72.
"The market might attract selling at higher levels before staging another rally," Harjit Singh of Wadhwa Associates said.
Reliance Industries gained 5.60 rupees to 309.50 on heavy purchases by foreign institutional investors and speculators.
Among declining shares, Hindustan Lever shed 15 rupees to 1,222, Nestle India lost five rupees to 275 and ITC dropped 0.50 rupee to 481.50.
